org.fujion.plotly.plot

Class PlotScatter3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.fujion.ancillary.Options
      • org.fujion.plotly.plot.PlotOptions
        • org.fujion.plotly.plot.PlotScatter3D
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IOptionMapTransform, IClientTransform

    public class PlotScatter3D
extends PlotOptions
    Options for 3D scatter plot.

    A 3D scatter plot uses x, y and z coordinates to display values for three variables for a set of data.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class org.fujion.plotly.plot.PlotOptions

    • Field Detail

      • connectgaps

        @Option
public Boolean connectgaps
        Determines whether or not gaps (i.e. {nan} or missing values) in the provided data arrays are connected.

      • error_x

        @Option
public final ErrorBarOptions error_x
        Options for x-axis error bars.

      • error_y

        @Option
public final ErrorBarOptions error_y
        Options for y-axis error bars.

      • error_z

        @Option
public final ErrorBarOptions error_z
        Options for z-axis error bars.

      • hovertext$array

        @Option(value="hovertext")
public String[] hovertext$array
        Text elements associated with each (x,y,z) triplet as an array of string where the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (x,y,z) coordinates. To be seen, trace "hoverinfo" must contain a "text" flag.

      • hovertext$string

        @Option(value="hovertext")
public String hovertext$string
        Text elements associated with each (x,y,z) triplet as a single string that appears over all the data points. If an array of string, the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (x,y,z) coordinates. To be seen, trace "hoverinfo" must contain a "text" flag.

      • line

        @Option
public final LineOptions line
        Style options for the line.

      • marker

        @Option
public final MarkerOptions marker
        Options for marker.

      • mode

        @Option
public String mode
        Any combination of "lines", "markers", "text" joined with a "+" OR "none". examples: "lines", "markers", "lines+markers", "lines+markers+text", "none" default: "lines+markers" Determines the drawing mode for this scatter trace. If the provided "mode" includes "text" then the "text" elements appear at the coordinates. Otherwise, the "text" elements appear on hover. If there are less than 20 points, then the default is "lines+markers". Otherwise, "lines".

      • projection_x

        @Option(value="projection.x")
public final ProjectionOptions projection_x
        Projection options for x axis.

      • projection_y

        @Option(value="projection.y")
public final ProjectionOptions projection_y
        Projection options for y axis.

      • projection_z

        @Option(value="projection.z")
public final ProjectionOptions projection_z
        Projection options for z axis.

      • scene

        @Option
public String scene
        Reference between this trace's 3D coordinate system and a 3D scene. If "scene" (the default value), the (x,y,z) coordinates refer to "layout.scene". If "scene2", the (x,y,z) coordinates refer to "layout.scene2", and so on.

      • surfaceaxis

        @Option
public Integer surfaceaxis
        If "-1" (the default), the scatter points are not filled with a surface. If "0", "1", "2", the scatter points are filled with a Delaunay surface about the x, y, z respectively.

      • surfacecolor

        @Option
public String surfacecolor
        The surface fill color.

      • text$array

        @Option(value="text")
public String[] text$array
        Text elements associated with each (x,y,z) triplet as an array of strings where the items are mapped in order to the this trace's (x,y,z) coordinates. If trace "hoverinfo" contains a "text" flag and "hovertext" is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels.

      • text$string

        @Option(value="text")
public String text$string
        Text elements associated with each (x,y,z) triplet as a single string that appears over all the data points. If trace "hoverinfo" contains a "text" flag and "hovertext" is not set, these elements will be seen in the hover labels.

      • textfont

        @Option
public final FontOptions textfont
        The text font.

      • textposition

        @Option
public TextPositionEnum textposition
        The positions of the "text" elements with respects to the (x,y) coordinates.

        Default: TOP_CENTER

      • x

        @Option
public Object[] x
        Data points for x-axis.

      • x$number

        @Option(value="x")
public double[] x$number
        Data points for x-axis. Alternate form for numeric data.

      • xcalendar

        @Option
public CalendarTypeEnum xcalendar
        The calendar system to use with "x" date data.

        Default: GREGORIAN

      • y

        @Option
public Object[] y
        Data points for y-axis.

      • y$number

        @Option(value="y")
public double[] y$number
        Data points for y-axis. Alternate form for numeric data.

      • ycalendar

        @Option
public CalendarTypeEnum ycalendar
        The calendar system to use with "y" date data.

        Default: GREGORIAN

      • z

        @Option
public Object[] z
        Data points for z-axis.

      • z$number

        @Option(value="z")
public double[] z$number
        Data points for z-axis. Alternate form for numeric data.

      • zcalendar

        @Option
public CalendarTypeEnum zcalendar
        The calendar system to use with "z" date data.

        Default: GREGORIAN
